definition: to serve as an official/an official/the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 將|将[jiang4]

sentences.english: Senator in a scandal he’ll loose his beltway to the fast track.
sentences.chinese: 要是议员涉足丑闻，他的亨通仕途就此终结了。

sentences.english: He has become an official of Xuezheng for only 83 days in Tongzhou.
sentences.chinese: 而仕途上也仅仅做了83天通州学正。

sentences.english: There were two main ways to start official career: annual tribute and imperial examination.
sentences.chinese: 国子学生员的仕途主要有岁贡和科举两条途径。

sentences.english: One is his positive in business, pursue the attitude of the merit and fame.
sentences.chinese: 一是他的积极于仕途，追求功名的态度。

sentences.english: The late Ming politics was dark and hard career, which leading to scholar-bureaucrats thoughts changed.
sentences.chinese: 晚明政治黑暗，仕途艰难，士人的心态发生变化。

definition: to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
to take an official post/to become a government employee
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to take up an official post
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
